paragraphs.text: Very interesting.

This was beautifully written and very interesting to read from start to finish. I find that my Instagram views dwarf the views I get on my Snapchat stories, which makes me favour Snapchat in terms of content curation and creation. I find Instagram Stories as a place that is generally too polished. What Snapchat gets right is how instant, live and in-the-moment the content is.

paragraphs.name: be6f

93050aa1da24.title: “ […] the company has also yet to prove that users are using Instagram specifically for stories.”

content.subtitle: It’s all about what the majority of people are looking for with the stories experience on the internet. And I bet they prefer a more open…

paragraphs.text: Huge difference
paragraphs.name: fce7

paragraphs.text: First, it’s worth noting that Instagram Stories is not its own app. It’s a feature bolted onto a pre-existing app that has already amassed more than 400M daily active users.
paragraphs.name: b96c

paragraphs.text: Sure, Snapchat similarly defines a daily active users as a person who opens the app once in a 24-hour-period, but consider the fact that the average snapchatter spends around half an hour on the app per day and 60% of users create content. Instagram is primarily used for browsing and the average user spends just 15 minutes per day within the app. It’s highly unlikely that all 15 of those minutes are spent engaging with Instagram Stories.
paragraphs.name: dc3e

paragraphs.text: Facebook won’t explicitly confirm what goes into calculating this metric, but it seems to be that if Beyonce blasts out an Instagram story to her nearly 100M Instagram followers and you happen to click it while scrolling through your feed, you are counted Instagram Stories daily active user.
paragraphs.name: 77c9

paragraphs.text: Instagram Stories
paragraphs.name: 5fc3

paragraphs.text: Facebook has previously faced criticism over lowering the threshold of what is considered engagement. On the company’s flagship app a view only counts as three seconds and in September it was revealed that the company had “significantly inflated average video view times for years.”
paragraphs.name: b36e

paragraphs.text: Snapchat is not just another social network. It represents a radical shift in the way we communicate. It has established new norms and broken the mold of what we think of as social media — and that is something that Instagram will most likely never be able to replicate.
